subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] how to name the letters
msgSnippet: ... I d advise you to use the names from the QS manual. They are after all the only ones with a valid claim to be canonical, being the ones chosen by Read
messageBody:
2013-04-22 06:21, guanolto skrev:

> Earlier when posting here I was referring to letters
> by their numbers, to avoid any confusion among
> different systems of naming the letters. But someone
> mentioned it was far preferable to mention letters by
> their names instead. It seems that people are
> comfortable with both of the two main naming systems.
> Or am I wrong?

I'd advise you to use the names from the QS manual.
They are after all the only ones with a valid claim
to be canonical, being the ones chosen by Read himself.
They are also easy enough to look up.

In my opinion it is also convenient sometimes to use
an X-SAMPA transliteration, to which we now thanks to
Nathan have an esy cheat sheet:
<http://adiabatic.github.io/Configuratronic-Quikscript-Cheat-Sheet/>.
I'd rather use Unicode IPA but YahooGroups usually mangles it...

Nathan, if you are listening, I'd suggest adding a "broad
X-SAMPA" version avoiding non-letters like so:

ROE = /r/
AT = /a/
UTTER = /V/
OWE = /oU/ ~ /Vu/

Moreover you might want to change the OWE transcription
to "/oU/ ~ /@U/" with the tilde outside the slashes,
since the tilde in X-SAMPA symbolizes (vowel)
nasalization, like in French.

/bpj
